title: Bertrand Russell discusses happiness
brief_description: Lord Russell describes the factors which he considers necessary for happiness: health, sufficient means to keep one from want, happy personal relations and successful work. He also discusses what he considers to be the sources of unhappiness: worry, envy and boredom. No other credits available.
